definition: probability (math.)
general/approximate
rate/frequency
to lead/to command/rash/hasty/frank/straightforward/generally/usually

sentences.english: The Polya urn problem is a famous model of wide application in probability.
sentences.chinese: 波利亞罐問題是概率論中的著名模型。

sentences.english: One of the first principles of probability is the idea of independence.
sentences.chinese: 概率論第一個基本原理中的一條是事件的獨立性。

sentences.english: Another development in the history of probability theory is the French representative of the Poisson .
sentences.chinese: 另一在概率論發展史上的代表人物是法國的泊松。

sentences.english: This is the probability limit theorems in the second basic form of the original first.
sentences.chinese: 這就是概率論中第二個基本極限定理的原始初形。

sentences.english: New fuzzy set theory is isomorphic to the fundamental part of probability theory.
sentences.chinese: 新模糊集合理論與概率論的基本部分是同構的。

sentences.english: This work has nothing to do with locality nor with classical probabilities.
sentences.chinese: 這一工作既不涉及定域性原理也與經典概率論無關。
